channel.title: BBC News - Latin America & Caribbean
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Bitcoin: El Salvador divided over legal tender law
item.description: The country will be the first to recognise the crypto-currency as legal tender from September 7.

item.title: Paddle boarder's close encounter with two curious whales
item.description: A drone filmed what the paddle boarder, out on the water on her birthday, calls a "magical moment".

item.title: South America's drought-hit Paraná river at 77-year low
item.description: The Paraná is a key waterway for shipping and also provides drinking water for millions of people.

item.title: Facebook says it helped Afghans escape to Mexico
item.description: The flight arrived in Mexico City on Wednesday, with 175 Afghan citizens on board, including 75 children.

item.title: Wildlife photo: Is this the world's most beautiful mosquito?
item.description: Both beauty and beast. A Sabethes mosquito is visually stunning but it's also a carrier of disease.

item.title: Image of bird at US-Mexico border wall wins contest
item.description: The winning image by Mexican photographer Alejandro Prieto shows a roadrunner at the border wall.

item.title: Brazil bank robbery: Hostages describe terrifying getaway car ordeal
item.description: Brazil hostages describe terrifying ordeal as bank robbers used them as human shields on getaway cars.

item.title: Lee 'Scratch' Perry: Tributes paid to the 'true legend' of reggae
item.description: Fellow musicians praise the legendary singer and music producer who has died aged 85.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Paralympic dream that started at the supermarket
item.description: Aruba had never had a Paralympic team until a student in her 20s decided to make it happen.

item.title: 'We felt free': Cubans remain defiant in face of protest crackdown
item.description: A month after rare anti-government protests in Cuba, many of those who took part remain defiant.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: The forgotten villages cut off from help
item.description: The tremor razed their homes, but these survivors could still die for a lack of basic supplies.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Search for survivors amid devastation
item.description: Almost 2,000 people are known to have died in Saturday's powerful earthquake.

item.title: From earrings to tiles – what you can do with plastic waste
item.description: How people around the world are recycling plastic waste themselves and turning it into cool stuff.

item.title: Brazil hopes we all get a taste for its favourite spirit
item.description: With domestic sales of cachaça falling last year, Brazilian producers want to export more.

item.title: Postcard from Chile arrives in Dorset after 30 years
item.description: The recipient says he was 'slightly confused' when it landed on his doormat three decades late.

item.title: Daniel Dias: History's greatest para-swimmer
item.description: Daniel Dias has won more than 25 medals for Brazil over the past four Paralympic Games but will be retiring after Tokyo.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Mother mourns daughter killed during christening
item.description: Locals say 22 people died when a church collapsed during a mass christening.

item.title: Haiti earthquake: Rescue efforts continue in Les Cayes
item.description: The death toll from the 7.2-magnitude quake is now over 2,000, with many still missing in towns like Les Cayes.

item.title: No help for these Haiti residents five days after earthquake
item.description: Five days after the earthquake that killed more than 2,000 people, many are still waiting for help.

item.title: Haiti struck by deadly 7.2-magnitude earthquake
item.description: A powerful earthquake has struck the Caribbean nation of Haiti, killing at least 304 people.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona star in tears as he receives ovation news conference
item.description: Lionel Messi is distraught as he receives a standing ovation from team-mates, journalists, officials and his family at a news conference confirming his departure from Barcelona.
